text: Alexander Elder Anton, CBE, FBA (1922–2011), often known as Sandy Anton, was a Scottish legal scholar. Anton was born on 2 July 1922. He served in the Gordon Highlanders from 1941 to 1945 and then attended the University of Aberdeen, where he graduated with a Master of Arts degree in 1946 and a Bachelor of Laws degree in 1949.Council of Europe, Yearbook of the European Convention on Human Rights (Martinus Nijhoff, 1984), p. 23. He then practised as a solicitor in Aberdeen for four years before working as a lecturer at the University of Aberdeen from 1953 to 1959. Anton was Professor of Jurisprudence at the University of Glasgow between 1959 and 1973."Anton, Alexander Elder", Who Was Who (online ed., Oxford University Press, December 2016). Retrieved 7 September 2019. Anton was elected a Fellow of the British Academy in 1972"Professor Alexander Anton FBA 1922–2011", The British Academy. Retrieved 7 September 2019. and appointed a Commander of the Order of the British Empire in the 1973 Birthday Honours.Supplement to the London Gazette, 2 June 1973 (issue 45984), p. 6480. He was also awarded with an honorary doctorate from the University of Aberdeen in 1993. He died on 6 June 2011. == References == == Further reading == * Paul Reid Beaumont, "The contribution of Alexander (Sandy) Anton to the development of private international law", Juridicial Review (2006), pp. 1–28.
